properties.address: Holy Trinity Church, Leytonstone, Greater London E11 4LD
properties.description: Space open to all people, offering free tea, coffee and snacks. There is an opportunity to shop for food essentials both fresh and non perishable from the community pantry. £3 buys £35+ worth of shopping. We serve free, nutritious and delicious breakfast and lunch from the Food Truck in partnership with The Skills Within. We can provide signposting and support to housing, health and wellbeing services. We are delighted to work with a digital artist to provide art courses for well being and a full Christmas dinner at Christmas from the local pub - the Leytonstone Tavern! The Food Share is a community where people are seen, heard and find space to belong. You are welcome here. Wheelchair access and toilet facilities, buggy access, creche facilities, baby changing, and all meals are vegan. All are welcome here, regardless of faith, sexuality, or gender orientation. This is a space where everyone is celebrated, respected, and valued for who they are. We believe in the inherent dignity and worth of every individual, and we strive to create a community where all feel safe, included, and empowered.
properties.title: Community Food Share

properties.description: Situated in the heart of Ilford for over 200 years, our church family comes from all over the world and we celebrate being a family that welcomes diverse cultures and languages. We have a wide range of facilities for children, parents and all age adults irrespective of religion, age or ethnicity. A daily offering of a welcoming atmosphere, with free hot drinks and biscuits! * Knitting Group – Mondays at 10.30am: make friends, drink tea and coffee as you knit. * Welcome Cafe and Toddlers – our Tuesday morning coffee morning. Free refreshments, board games and relaxing chat for adults and toys for pre-school and babies. * English Classes (Language Link) – supporting women and men to learn English. Women - Wednesdays & Thursdays 10am-12pm. Men - Thursdays & Fridays 10am-12pm. * AMPED children's Club each Friday from 6.45-8pm. Games, Sport and Quizzes on a Biblical theme for everybody. * Jeta e Re is a drop-in for Albanian speakers and friends. We have a children's programme and support for ESOL classes too. Saturdays 2-5pm.

properties.description: Stratford Advice Arcade is a community advice centre and a charity organisation in Newham. It acts as a hub where multiple advice, support, and advocacy services are located under one roof. Services and Activities. Here are some of the things we offer: Advice & information on subjects like benefits, money and debt, housing rights, health, employment and training. Counselling services via the organisations based in here. Outreach sessions by external agencies (e.g. for legal advice, welfare rights) Advocacy services, such as Independent Mental Capacity Advocacy, Citizen Advocacy & Professional Community Advocacy through Voiceability Newham. Support for vulnerable groups including children, families, older people etc via our organisation - Families & Community Support Service.

properties.description: In a prime riverside location Waterfront Leisure Centre is a fantastic multi-use community sport and leisure facility located in the heart of Woolwich, SE18. It boasts a modern newly refurbished 150 plus station gym with the latest Technogym cardiovascular, strength and resistance machines. A new functional fitness area is the perfect place for a HIIT work out and two further studios host a wide variety of Fitness Classes for all ages and abilities. This includes a multi purpose black out studio for interactive group cycle and yoga classes. The centre has a 25m fitness pool and a leisure pool with slides and a wave machine, sauna and Jacuzzi making it the perfect place for all your water activities including our Better Swim School lessons, aqua aerobics, fitness swims and family sessions. Facilities available for hire include a multi-use sports hall, indoor 5-a-side pitch and squash courts. Waterfront Leisure Centre is conveniently located, only a short walk from Woolwich DLR Station and the new Elizabeth Line Tube Station. There are excellent road, bus and train links from Greenwich, Charlton, Blackheath, Plumstead, Belvedere and Erith and Kent. We look forward to welcoming you very soon.
properties.title: Waterfront Leisure Centre

properties.address: Barking Learning Centre, Barking, Essex IG11 7NB
properties.description: Become a Polar Bear! Who Is It For? This group is for adults diagnosed with Bipolar Disorder looking for a space to share experiences and receive support in managing their condition. What to expect: • Weekly sessions begin with a check-in: “How was your week?", "Current mood?" • discussions focus on managing mood swings, emotional regulation, and building resilience. • Peer support to identify early signs of phase changes, such as depression or hypomania. Key Objectives: • Early detection and Intervention: Recognising signs of phase shifts to ensure faster recovery and lower inpatient care rates. • Minimising Risks: Supporting members in managing depressive or hypomanic episodes, reducing harm such as reckless spending or suicidal thoughts. • Ongoing Support: Weekly, in-person groups. The group is held at Barking Library every Wednesday from 6pm- 8pm. Please contact us to register before can you attend. -Email: contact@sheltonshelters.com -registration form on www.sheltonshelters.com -per phone 07746746789
properties.title: Weekly Bipolar Disorder Peer Support Group
